The member presiding at a meeting of the Authority has a deliberative vote and also has a casting vote if the number of votes for and against a motion is equal.
The member presiding at a meeting of the Authority must ask each member who is present at the meeting to indicate how he or she has voted.
The result of the vote, showing which way each member has voted, must be recorded in the minutes.
A decision supported by a majority of the votes cast at the meeting of the Authority at which a quorum is present is the decision of the Authority.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Minutes
section.content: The Authority must maintain minutes of the proceedings, including a record of all decisions made, at each meeting of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A resolution is a valid resolution of the Authority, even if it is not passed at a meeting of the Authority, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proper notice of it is given to all members of the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is signed, or assented to, by a majority of the members of the Authority by letter, fax or other electronic transmission.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a resolution to which that subsection applies may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form of one document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the form of more than one document, each in the same form and signed by one or more members of the Authority.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), the date of a resolution referred to in this section is the date on which the last of the members of the Authority constituting a majority of the members signs or assents to the resolution.

If any member of the Authority requests, by written notice addressed to the Chairperson, that a resolution proposed to be made under subsection (1) be referred to a meeting of the Authority for consideration, the proposed resolution must be referred to a meeting of the Authority.
A request under subsection (4) must be made within 14 days after the date on which the notice referred to in subsection (1)(b) is given.
If, in respect of any matter being dealt with by circulating written resolutions, a request is made under subsection (4), any resolution signed, or assented to, under subsection (1)(c) becomes void.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Decisions not invalidated by defects in appointment etc.
section.leadIn: Decisions of the Authority are not invalidated solely by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a defect in the appointment of a member of the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vacancy among the Authority’s members;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the absence of a member of the Authority from the meeting at which the decision was taken; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an irregularity in the procedures adopted by the Authority that does not affect the merit of the decision taken.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Financial year
section.leadIn: The financial year of the Authority is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period beginning on the date on which this section comes into operation and ending on the next 31 March; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of 12 months ending on 31 March in each subsequent year.

subsection.leadIn: The funds of the Authority consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all the money received by the Authority by way of fees, levies and penalties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all other money and property, including interest and accumulations of income, lawfully received by the Authority for its purposes.

subsection.leadIn: Any funds of the Authority that are not immediately required by it for the performance of its functions may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: deposited on fixed term or call deposit or in a savings account in a bank nominated by the Financial Secretary, either generally or in a particular case, for that purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: invested in a manner approved by the Financial Secretary.

subsection.content: The Authority is exempt from taxation under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112).
To avoid doubt, subsection (1) does not apply in relation to any remuneration, benefits or expenses paid out of the funds of the Authority to a member of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep accounts and other records that accurately record and explain the financial transactions and financial position of the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that a statement of accounts is prepared within 3 months, or a longer period the Secretary allows, after the end of each financial year of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The statement of accounts must give a true and fair view of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the state of affairs of the Authority as at the end of that financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the results of the operations and cash flows of the Authority in that financial year.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after the date on which this section comes into operation, the Authority must appoint an auditor to audit its statement of accounts.

subsection.leadIn: The auditor must, as soon as practicable after the end of each financial year of the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: audit the accounts and statement of accounts required under section 18 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit a report on the statement of accounts to the Authority.

subsection.content: As soon as practicable, and in any case within 6 months, after the end of each financial year of the Authority, the Authority must prepare a report about its activities in that financial year.

subsection.leadIn: The report must contain the following information in relation to that financial year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an outline of the investigations conducted by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a summary of complaints received;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an outline of all hearings conducted under section 24 of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an outline of all proceedings brought before appeal tribunals.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Annual report and audited accounts to be laid on table of Legislative Council

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable, and in any case within 6 months, after the end of each financial year of the Authority, the Authority must give the following documents to the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of its annual report prepared under section 20 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of its statement of accounts;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy of the auditor’s report on the statement of accounts.

subsection.content: The Secretary must arrange for the documents received under subsection (1) to be laid on the table of the Legislative Council.

The Director of Audit may, for any financial year of the Authority, conduct an examination into the economy, efficiency and effectiveness with which the Authority has used its resources in performing its functions.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of conducting the examination, the Director of Audit may, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have full and free access to all accounts, records and documents in the custody or under the control of the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make a copy of the whole or any part of those accounts, records and documents; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require a person who holds or is accountable for those accounts, records or documents to give any information or explanation that the Director of Audit considers necessary.

subsection.content: The Director of Audit may report to the President of the Legislative Council the results of the examination.
The Authority may establish a standing committee for hearing disciplinary matters under Part 5 of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may also establish one or more than one committee (whether or not as a standing committee)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to advise the Authority on any matters (within the scope of the Authority’s functions) that the Authority refers to it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to perform any functions of the Authority that the Authority delegates to it.

subsection.content: Every member of a committee is to be appointed by the Authority.
A committee must consist of at least 3 members.
A committee may include members who are not members of the Authority but, for a standing committee, a majority of the members must be members of the Authority.
The chairperson of a committee must be a member of the Authority.
When the Authority establishes a committee, it must specify, in writing, the terms of reference of the committee.
The Authority may, by written notice, amend the terms of reference of a committee.
Subject to section 48(9) of this Ordinance and any directions that may be given by the Authority, a committee may regulate its own procedure, including the determination of its quorum.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on application, issue—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence.

subsection.content: A provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence may only be issued to an individual.
A licence issued under this section is not transferable.
A licence issued under this section remains in force until the end of the period specified in it.
The period specified under subsection (4) must not be longer than 36 months beginning on the date on which the licence is issued.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: officer (高級人員) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622).

subsection.leadIn: An application for a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made within 36 months beginning on the date on which this section comes into operation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be made to the Authority in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must contain the prescribed information; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the prescribed documents and application fee.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not issue a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is satisfied that the applicant does not meet all the prescribed criteria for holding a PMP (Tier 1) licence or PMP (Tier 2) licence, but—

subparagraph.content: the applicant is a suitable person to hold the licence for which the applicant applies; and
the applicant meets all the prescribed criteria for holding the licence for which the applicant applies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the prescribed fee for the issue of the licence for which the applicant applies.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a)(i), in determining whether the applicant is a suitable person to hold the licence for which the applicant applies, the Authority must have regard to the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: whether the applicant has been convicted of a disciplinary offence or a criminal offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: whether the applicant is or was an officer of, or a partner in, a property management company whose application for a PMC licence has been refused or whose PMC licence has been revoked or suspended.

subsection.content: The Authority may impose on a licence issued under section 1 of this Schedule those conditions, including prescribed conditions, that it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides not to issue a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Appeal in relation to provisional PMP licences

subsection.content: An applicant for a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence who is aggrieved by a decision not to issue the licence may lodge an appeal.
Part 6 of this Ordinance, with necessary modifications, applies to an appeal under subsection (1) as it applies to an appeal under that Part.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Provisions applicable to holders of provisional PMP licences
section.leadIn: The following provisions, with necessary modifications, apply to the holder of a licence issued under section 1 of this Schedule as they apply to a licensed PMP—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 12 and 13 of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Parts 5 and 6 of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 63 of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by regulation, prescribe—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the fees payable in an application for a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the criteria for holding a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the fees payable for the issue of a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the conditions that may be imposed on a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence or provisional PMP (Tier 2) licence.

subsection.leadIn: The criteria mentioned in subsection (1)(c)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: may impose more stringent requirements for a provisional PMP (Tier 1) licence.
